## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been playing around with defining new currencies on Verus, and I was wondering, what is the purpose of setting `proofprotocol` to 1 when defining a new currency?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, there is no specific purpose of setting `proofprotocol` to 1 when defining a new currency. In fact, setting `proofprotocol` to 2 allows the controller of the chain ID to mint new coins, as demonstrated in the example where `proofprotocol` is set to 2 when defining the "mycoin" currency. So, if you want to have control over minting new coins, you should set `proofprotocol` to 2.

**User:**
That makes sense. I've also been experimenting with VRSCTEST, and I was wondering, how do I update my VRSCTEST installation without deleting any directories?

**AI Assistant:**
Unfortunately, if you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this, you need to delete specific directories before running the new update. The directories to be deleted vary depending on your operating system (Linux, MacOS, or Windows). Simply updating without deleting these directories is not an option. You'll need to delete the required directories to ensure a successful update.
What is the purpose of setting `proofprotocol` to 1 when defining a new currency?

There is no specific purpose of setting `proofprotocol` to 1 when defining a new currency. In fact, setting `proofprotocol` to 2 allows the controller of the chain ID to mint new coins, as demonstrated in the example where `proofprotocol` is set to 2 when defining the "mycoin" currency.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":96, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"conversions":[0.01, 1.0],"minpreconversion":[1000,1000]}'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/VRSCTEST
~/.verustest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/VRSCTEST
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩⁨/VerusTest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
"%APPDATA%"\VerusTest
```
How do I update my VRSCTEST installation without deleting any directories?

If you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this, you need to delete specific directories before running the new update. The directories to be deleted vary depending on your operating system (Linux, MacOS, or Windows). Simply updating without deleting these directories is not an option.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":96, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"conversions":[0.01, 1.0],"minpreconversion":[1000,1000]}'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
